chunks.original_text: 宋佚名撰。 十一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》太平部。 参校本：明刻本《仙授理伤续断秘方》（简称《理伤续断方》）、《四库全书》本《急救仙方》（简称『四库本』）。 急救仙方序 医之疗疾，莫难于妇人，妇人之疾，莫重于胎产。 胎产之重者何？ 盖以一身之疾否，系乎母子之存亡，故《千金方》部居独以妇人厕其首，此思邈孙真人之用心不苟矣。 世之胎产诸方，不为不富，然其间多犯冗、僻、贵。 冗则仓卒之际难备，僻则穷乡下邑难得，贵则贫窭之家难求，是三者虽非君子用心之不周，而人之蒙其惠者，往往求什一于千百。 今此方之编，分为三类，末附以杂病，虽不能如诸方之广载博该，要之不犯冗、僻、贵，而凡胎产危急之证，大略亦尽之矣。 俾仓卒之际、穷乡下邑、贫窭之家，皆得易而求之，虽一草一木足以收效，岂若前三者之难为功哉！ 苟有用者，始信其为闺门之重宝云。 金川徐守贞序。 急救仙方卷之一 妊娠诸疾品 术苓#1汤，治妇人胎孕不安。 白术 黄苓各等分 右为粗末，每服三钱，水二盏，当归一根，同煎至一盏，稍温服。 立效散，治胎动不安，如重物所坠，冷如冰。 川芎　当归各等分 右为粗末，每服五钱，水煎，食前温服。 或下血，心腹痛，酒水相半煎服。 保安散，治妊娠因有所伤，胎动疼不可忍，及血崩不止。 连皮缩砂不以多少，炒黑去皮 右为细末，温酒调下。 觉腹中热，则胎已安矣。 治妊娠胎动不安，或腰痛，胞转抢心，下血不止。 石菖蒲根捣汁三升饮之 又方，艾叶如鸡子大，以酒四升，煮取二升，分二服。 良。 又方，槟榔一两，为末，葱白汤调下一钱匕，佳。 二黄散，治有孕胎漏下血。 生地黄 熟地黄各等分 右为细末，每服三钱，煎白术枳壳调下。 立圣散，治妊娠下血不止。 鸡肝二具，用好酒一升煮熟，共酒食之，大效。 枳苓散，治胎漏下血，或因事下血。 枳壳去穰，半两，麸炒　黄芩半两　白术二两 右为粗末，每服五七钱，水煎，去滓，食前服。 治妊娠误有失坠，或推筑着，疼痛难忍。 当归一两　新青竹茹二合 右以好酒二升，煮十数沸，分三服。 又方，以川芎为末，每服二钱，温酒调下。 治妊娠因顿跌，胎动不安，腰痛腹满，或有所下，或胎上抢心。 熟地黄二两　白芍药　艾叶　当归　甘草　阿胶炒珠　黄耆　川芎各一两 右□咀，每服半两，姜三片，枣一枚，水煎服。 火龙散，治妊娠心气痛。 艾叶半两、盐炒一半　茴香半两，炒　川练子半两，炒 右为细末，水煎，食前服。 通气散，治妊娠腰痛，状不可忍，此药神妙。 破故纸不以多少，瓦上炒香熟，为末，嚼胡桃肉一个，空心，温酒调下三钱。 芍归汤，治妊娠胎动，子死或不死。 川芎　当归各等分 右□咀，每服三五钱，加紫苏数叶，酒水合煎服。 死者即下，未死者即安。 黄连汤，治妊娠儿在腹中啼。 黄连二钱　生甘草一钱 右浓煎汁，令母呷之。
chunks.translated_text:
**An Anonymous Song Dynasty Compilation.** Eleven juan. Base text from: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era, Taiping Section*. Collated with: Ming dynasty block-printed *Immortal’s Secret Formula for Treating Wounds and Rejoining Fractures* (abbreviated as *Formula for Wounds and Fractures*), and *Siku Quanshu* edition of *Emergency Immortal Remedies* (abbreviated as *Siku Edition*).

**Preface to *Emergency Immortal Remedies***
In the art of medicine, nothing is more challenging than treating women’s ailments; among women’s ailments, none is graver than those of pregnancy and childbirth. Why are pregnancy and childbirth so grave? Because the affliction of one body concerns the life or death of both mother and child. Thus, *Essential Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold* places the section on women’s disorders at its very beginning—such was Sun Simiao’s meticulous intent. Though existing formulas for pregnancy and childbirth are abundant, many suffer from being cumbersome, obscure, or costly. Cumbersome remedies are difficult to prepare in emergencies; obscure ingredients are hard to obtain in remote villages; and costly ones are beyond the reach of the impoverished. Though these three shortcomings do not stem from any lack of benevolence on the part of the authors, those who benefit from such remedies are often but one in a thousand. This compilation, divided into three categories with miscellaneous disorders appended, does not aspire to the exhaustive breadth of other works. Yet it avoids the pitfalls of being cumbersome, obscure, or costly, and in essence, it covers the majority of critical conditions in pregnancy and childbirth. Thus, in emergencies, in remote villages, and in impoverished households, these remedies may be easily obtained. Even a single herb or plant can yield results—how unlike the three aforementioned difficulties! Should anyone make use of these formulas, they will come to recognize them as a treasure for the inner chambers.

**Preface by Xu Shouzhen of Jinchuan.**

**Emergency Immortal Remedies, Juan 1**
**Category: Disorders During Pregnancy**

**Atractylodes and Poria Decoction (#1)** – Treats restless fetal movement in pregnant women.
*White Atractylodes (baizhu), Scutellaria (huangqin)* – equal parts.
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take three *qian*, decoct in two cups of water with one piece of *Angelica sinensis* (danggui) until reduced to one cup. Take warm.

**Instant Efficacy Powder** – Treats restless fetal movement, as if weighed down by a heavy object, cold as ice.
*Ligusticum (chuanxiong), Angelica sinensis (danggui)* – equal parts.
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take five *qian*, decoct in water, and take warm before meals. If bleeding or abdominal pain occurs, decoct in equal parts wine and water.

**Preserving Peace Powder** – Treats restless fetal movement due to injury, unbearable pain, or unstoppable uterine bleeding.
*Amomum (suosha)* – any quantity, stir-fried until black, then husk removed.
Grind into fine powder. Take with warm wine. When warmth is felt in the abdomen, the fetus is stabilized.

**Treatment for restless fetal movement, lumbar pain, fetal pressure on the heart, or unstoppable bleeding.**
*Pound three sheng of fresh Acorus calamus (shichangpu) root to extract the juice and drink.*
*Alternative formula:* Take *Artemisia* (aiye) the size of a chicken egg, decoct in four *sheng* of wine until reduced to two *sheng*, and divide into two doses. Effective.
*Another formula:* Grind one *liang* of *Areca* (binglang) into powder. Take one *qianbi* with scallion broth. Excellent.

**Two Yellows Powder** – Treats bleeding during pregnancy.
*Fresh Rehmannia (shengdihuang), Prepared Rehmannia (shudihuang)* – equal parts.
Grind into fine powder. For each dose, take three *qian*, decoct with *White Atractylodes* (baizhu) and *Bitter Orange* (zhike) and take.

**Instant Sage Powder** – Treats unstoppable bleeding during pregnancy.
*Two chicken livers, simmered in one sheng of good wine until done.* Consume both the livers and the wine. Highly effective.

**Bitter Orange and Scutellaria Powder** – Treats bleeding during pregnancy or bleeding due to external causes.
*Bitter Orange (zhike)* – half a *liang*, stir-fried with bran after removing the pith.
*Scutellaria (huangqin)* – half a *liang*.
*White Atractylodes (baizhu)* – two *liang*.
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take five to seven *qian*, decoct in water, strain, and take before meals.

**Treatment for miscarriage due to falls, blows, or trauma, causing unbearable pain.**
*Angelica sinensis (danggui)* – one *liang*.
*Fresh green bamboo shavings (qingzhuru)* – two *ge*.
Decoct in two *sheng* of good wine until boiling ten times, then divide into three doses.
*Alternative formula:* Grind *Ligusticum* (chuanxiong) into powder. For each dose, take two *qian* with warm wine.

**Treatment for restless fetal movement due to falls, lumbar pain, abdominal fullness, bleeding, or fetal pressure on the heart.**
*Prepared Rehmannia (shudihuang)* – two *liang*.
*White Peony (baishaoyao), Artemisia (aiye), Angelica sinensis (danggui), Licorice (gancao), Ass Hide Glue (ejiao)* – stir-fried to pearls.
*Astragalus (huangqi), Ligusticum (chuanxiong)* – one *liang* each.
[Method missing] For each dose, take half a *liang*, with three slices of ginger and one jujube, decoct in water and take.

**Fire Dragon Powder** – Treats heart qi pain during pregnancy.
*Artemisia (aiye)* – half a *liang*, half stir-fried with salt.
*Fennel (huixiang)* – half a *liang*, stir-fried.
*Toosendan (chuanlianzi)* – half a *liang*, stir-fried.
Grind into fine powder. Decoct in water and take before meals.

**Qi-Freeing Powder** – Treats unbearable lumbar pain during pregnancy. This formula is divinely effective.
*Psoralea (poguzhi)* – any quantity, stir-fried on a tile until fragrant.
Grind into powder. Chew one walnut meat, take three *qian* on an empty stomach with warm wine.

**Peony and Angelica Decoction** – Treats restless fetal movement, whether the fetus is dead or alive.
*Ligusticum (chuanxiong), Angelica sinensis (danggui)* – equal parts.
[Method missing] For each dose, take three to five *qian*, add several leaves of *Perilla* (zisuye), and decoct in equal parts wine and water. If the fetus is dead, it will be expelled; if alive, it will be stabilized.

**Coptis Decoction** – Treats fetal crying in the womb.
*Coptis (huanglian)* – two *qian*.
*Fresh Licorice (shenggancao)* – one *qian*.
Decoct into a thick broth and have the mother sip it.

chunks.original_text: 又方，以多年空屋下鼠穴中土一块，令母噙之，即止。 猪苓散，治妊娠从脚上肿至腹，小便微利，微渴引饮。 猪苓五两 右为末，以熟水服方寸匕，日三。 葶苈散，治妊娠遍身洪肿。 葶苈二两　白术五两　白茯芩　桑白皮　郁李仁各二两 右为粗末，水六升，煮取二升，分三服。 小便利即差。 又方，泽泻二两　葶苈二两　茯芩　枳壳麸炒　白术各六两 右为细切，以水六升，煮取二升，分二服。 防己汤，治妊娠脾虚，遍身浮肿，心腹胀满，喘促，小便不利。 防己七钱半　桑白皮　赤茯苓　紫苏茎叶各一两　木香二钱半 大便不通加枳壳、槟榔。 右粗末，每服四钱，姜四片，水同煎，食前服。 当归芍药散，治妊娠腹中绞痛，心下急痛。 白芍药四两　当归　茯芩各一两　泽泻二两　川芎二两　甘草炙，一两 右为细末，每服三钱，食前温酒调服，以蜜丸亦可。 人参散，治妊娠霍乱吐泻，心烦腹痛。 人参一两　厚朴一两，姜制　陈皮一两　当归炒　甘草半两，炙　乾生姜一两 呕逆不止，加益智仁、煨草豆寇。 右□咀，每服四钱，枣三个，水煎服。 茯芩半夏汤，治妊娠恶阻，心中愦闷，头目眩晕，四肢怠惰，百节烦疼，胸膈痰逆，呕吐#2恶心，嫌闻食气，好啖酸咸，多卧少起，全不进食，先服茯芩半夏汤，次服茯芩丸。 半夏一两二钱，汤洗七次，炒　赤茯芩　熟地黄各七钱半　陈皮　人参　旋覆花　芍药　川芎　桔梗各半两　甘草半两，炒 右为粗末，每服五钱，姜三片同煎，食前热服。 茯芩丸 赤茯丸　人参　桂炒　半夏汤洗，炒　陈皮　乾姜炮，各五钱　白术　葛根各一两　甘草一两，炙　枳实二两，麸炒 右为细末，炼蜜丸桐子大，米饮下三五十丸，食前。 竹沥汤，治妊娠恒若烦闷，心胆怯，此名子烦。 茯芩三两　竹沥一升 右以水四升，煎取二升，分三服，不差再服。 又方，茯芩四两　防风　麦门冬去心　黄苓各三两　人参一两五钱 右□咀，每服四钱，淡竹叶数片同煎服。 不得眠，加酸枣仁。 紫苏饮，治妊娠胎上逼，胀满疼痛，谓之子悬。 兼治临产惊悸，气结连日不下。 紫苏一两　当归　甘草各二钱半　人参　川芎　大腹皮　陈皮　白芍药各半两 右□咀，每服半两，水一盏半，姜四片，葱白七寸，去滓，空心温服。 知母散，治妊娠烦躁闷乱、口乾及胎藏热。 知母　甘草　麦门冬去心，各半两　黄苓　赤茯苓各七钱 右□咀，每服四钱，竹茹一块，水煎服，四肢壮热，加葛根、柴胡。 治妊娠忽下黄汁如胶，或如小豆汁。 苎根切，二升 右水四升，煎取二升，分二服，每服入酒半升，再煎服。 厚朴散，治妊娠下利黄水不止。 厚朴三两，姜汁炙　黄连二两　肉豆寇五个，连皮 右□咀，用水二升，煮取一升服。 治妊娠无故卒下血。 阿胶二两重，以蚌粉同炒珠，捣为末　生地黄半斤，捣取汁 右以清酒三升，将二味搅匀温过，分三服。 治妊娠无故尿血。 龙骨一两，为末　蒲黄五钱，研匀 右以酒调方寸匕，日三服。 治妊娠藏气本虚，脾胃久弱，脐腹疼痛，滑泄无度，产后同。 厚朴二两，姜汁浸，炒黄　草豆寇一个，煨　肉豆寇一个，面裹煨 右□咀，每服三钱，姜三片，煎服。 大宁散，治妊娠下利赤白，及泄泻疼痛垂死者。

**Additional Formula** – Take a lump of earth from a mouse burrow beneath a long-abandoned house and have the mother hold it in her mouth; this will immediately cease the condition.

**Polyporus (Zhuling) Powder** – Treats pregnancy edema ascending from the feet to the abdomen, with scant urination and slight thirst with desire to drink.
*Polyporus (zhuling)* – five *liang*.
Grind into powder. Take one square-inch spoonful with warm water, three times daily.

**Lepidium (Tingli) Powder** – Treats generalized severe edema during pregnancy.
*Lepidium (tingli)* – two *liang*
*White Atractylodes (baizhu)* – five *liang*
*White Poria (baifuling), Mulberry Root Bark (sangbaipi), Bush Cherry Seed (yuliren)* – two *liang* each
Grind into coarse powder. Boil in six *sheng* of water until two *sheng* remain; divide into three doses. Recovery follows when urination becomes unobstructed.

**Alternative Formula**
*Alisma (zexie)* – two *liang*
*Lepidium (tingli)* – two *liang*
*Poria (fuling), Stir-fried Aurantium (zhike), White Atractylodes (baizhu)* – six *liang* each
Cut finely. Boil in six *sheng* of water until two *sheng* remain; divide into two doses.

**Stephania (Fangji) Decoction** – Treats spleen deficiency during pregnancy with generalized edema, abdominal distension and fullness, dyspnea, and scant urination.
*Stephania (fangji)* – seven and a half *qian*
*Mulberry Root Bark (sangbaipi), Red Poria (chifuling), Perilla Stem and Leaf (zisujingye)* – one *liang* each
*Costus Root (muxiang)* – two and a half *qian*
For constipation, add *Aurantium (zhike)* and *Areca (binglang)*.
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take four *qian*, add four slices of ginger, and decoct in water. Take before meals.

**Tangkuei and Peony Powder** – Treats colicky abdominal pain and epigastric urgency during pregnancy.
*White Peony (baishaoyao)* – four *liang*
*Tangkuei (danggui), Poria (fuling)* – one *liang* each
*Alisma (zexie)* – two *liang*
*Ligusticum (chuanxiong)* – two *liang*
*Licorice (gancao)* – one *liang*, roasted
Grind into fine powder. Take three *qian* before meals with warm wine, or form into honey pills.

**Ginseng Powder** – Treats cholera-like vomiting and diarrhea with vexation and abdominal pain during pregnancy.
*Ginseng (renshen)* – one *liang*
*Magnolia Bark (houpo)* – one *liang*, ginger-processed
*Tangerine Peel (chenpi)* – one *liang*
*Tangkuei (danggui)* – stir-fried
*Licorice (gancao)* – half a *liang*, roasted
*Dried Ginger (ganshengjiang)* – one *liang*
For incessant retching, add *Alpinia (yizhiren)* and *roasted Katsumadai (caodoukou)*.
Cut. For each dose, take four *qian*, add three *jujubes*, and decoct in water.

**Poria and Pinellia Decoction** – Treats pregnancy-related nausea and vomiting with mental clouding, dizziness, limb fatigue, generalized aching, phlegm counterflow, retching, aversion to food odors, craving for sour or salty flavors, somnolence, and inability to eat. First administer *Poria and Pinellia Decoction*, then follow with *Poria Pills*.
*Pinellia (banxia)* – one *liang* two *qian*, washed seven times in hot water and stir-fried
*Red Poria (chifuling), Prepared Rehmannia (shudihuang)* – seven and a half *qian* each
*Tangerine Peel (chenpi), Ginseng (renshen), Inula Flower (xuanfuhua), Peony (shaoyao), Ligusticum (chuanxiong), Platycodon (jiegeng)* – half a *liang* each
*Licorice (gancao)* – half a *liang*, stir-fried
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take five *qian*, add three slices of ginger, and decoct. Take warm before meals.

**Poria Pills**
*Red Poria (chifuling), Ginseng (renshen), Cinnamon (gui)* – stir-fried
*Pinellia (banxia)* – washed in hot water and stir-fried
*Tangerine Peel (chenpi), Dried Ginger (ganjiang)* – five *qian* each, roasted
*White Atractylodes (baizhu), Kudzu (gegen)* – one *liang* each
*Licorice (gancao)* – one *liang*, roasted
*Aurantium Immaturum (zhishi)* – two *liang*, bran-fried
Grind into fine powder, form into firmiana-seed-sized honey pills. Take thirty to fifty pills with rice water before meals.

**Bamboo Sap Decoction** – Treats persistent vexation and oppression during pregnancy with timidity, known as "fetal vexation."
*Poria (fuling)* – three *liang*
*Bamboo Sap (zhuli)* – one *sheng*
Boil in four *sheng* of water until two *sheng* remain; divide into three doses. If unresolved, repeat.

**Alternative Formula**
*Poria (fuling)* – four *liang*
*Ledebouriella (fangfeng), Ophiopogon (maimendong)* – three *liang* each, with hearts removed
*Scutellaria (huangqin)* – three *liang*
*Ginseng (renshen)* – one *liang* five *qian*
Cut. For each dose, take four *qian*, add a few *Lophatherum (danzhuye)* leaves, and decoct. For insomnia, add *Spiny Jujube Seed (suanzaoren)*.

**Perilla Drink** – Treats upward pressure of the fetus causing distension, fullness, and pain, known as "fetal elevation." Also treats labor-related fright palpitations and prolonged qi stagnation preventing delivery.
*Perilla (zisu)* – one *liang*
*Tangkuei (danggui), Licorice (gancao)* – two and a half *qian* each
*Ginseng (renshen), Ligusticum (chuanxiong), Areca Peel (dafupi), Tangerine Peel (chenpi), White Peony (baishaoyao)* – half a *liang* each
Cut. For each dose, take half a *liang*, boil in one and a half cups of water with four slices of ginger and seven inches of scallion white. Strain and take warm on an empty stomach.

**Anemarrhena Powder** – Treats vexation, agitation, and dry mouth during pregnancy, as well as fetal heat.
*Anemarrhena (zhimu), Licorice (gancao)* – half a *liang* each
*Ophiopogon (maimendong)* – half a *liang*, with heart removed
*Scutellaria (huangqin), Red Poria (chifuling)* – seven *qian* each
Cut. For each dose, take four *qian*, add a piece of *Bamboo Shavings (zhuru)*, and decoct. For generalized heat in the limbs, add *Kudzu (gegen)* and *Bupleurum (chaihu)*.

**Treatment for Sudden Discharge of Yellow, Glue-like Fluid or Small Bean-like Juice During Pregnancy**
*Ramie Root (zhugen)* – two *sheng*, cut
Boil in four *sheng* of water until two *sheng* remain; divide into two doses. For each dose, add half a *sheng* of wine and decoct again before taking.

**Magnolia Bark Powder** – Treats incessant discharge of yellow water during pregnancy.
*Magnolia Bark (houpo)* – three *liang*, ginger-juice roasted
*Coptis (huanglian)* – two *liang*
*Nutmeg (roudoukou)* – five pieces, with skin

**Black Soybean Decoction** – Miraculously effective for treating pregnancy with heat-induced dysentery.
*Black Soybeans (heidou)* – thirty grains
*Licorice (gancao)* – two and a half *cun*, half raw, half prepared
*Poppy Husk (yingsuke)* – twenty-one pieces, half raw, half stir-fried
Grind into coarse powder. For a single dose, decoct with three slices of fresh ginger and take before meals.

**Coptis Decoction** – Treats pregnancy with heat-induced dysentery.
*Coptis (huanglian)* – one *liang*
*Phellodendron (huangbo)* – one *liang*
*Gardenia Seed (zhiziren)* – ten pieces
Cut. For each dose, take five *qian*, steep in two cups of water for three hours, then boil ten times. Strain and take all at once. For vomiting, add fresh ginger and tangerine peel.

**Glutinous Rice Decoction** – Treats pregnancy with dysentery, abdominal pain, and painful urination.

*Chinese Angelica (danggui)* – one *liang*, stir-fried

Finely cut and mix evenly. Boil in two cups of water until one and two-tenths cups remain. Strain and divide into four doses.

**Coptis Powder** – Treats pregnancy with persistent red and white dysentery with pus and blood.

*Chinese Angelica (danggui)* – six *qian* each
*Mugwort Leaf (aiye)* – four *qian*
*Phellodendron (huangbo)* – four *qian*
*Dried Ginger (ganjiang)* – four *qian*, blast-fried
Grind into fine powder. Take one square-inch spoonful with rice water on an empty stomach, three times daily.

**Mantis Egg-Case Powder** – Treats pregnancy with urinary incontinence.
*Mantis Egg-Case (sangpiaoxiao)* – twelve pieces, roasted
Grind into fine powder. Take two *qian* with rice water on an empty stomach.

**Swallowwort Powder** – Treats pregnancy with involuntary urination.
*Swallowwort (baiwei)*
*White Peony (baishaoyao)* – stir-fried, equal parts
Grind into powder. Take two *qian* with warm wine before meals.

**Poria Powder** – Treats pregnancy with urinary retention.
*Red Poria (chifuling)*
*Musk Mallow Seed (huangkuizi)* – equal parts
Cut. For each dose, take five *qian*, decoct in two cups of water until one cup remains, and take warm. If urination remains blocked, suspect *turned bladder* (zhuangbao); add a small amount of charred hair and take. Extremely effective.

**Plantain Seed Decoction** – Treats pregnancy with strangury, painful urination, and heat obstruction in the water pathway.
*Plantain Seed (cheqianzi)* – one *liang*
*Musk Mallow Root (kuigen)* – five *qian*, cut
Boil the two ingredients in one and a half cups of water until half remains. Take warm on an empty stomach.

**Areca Peel Powder** – Treats pregnancy with red, painful urination and constipation.
*Areca Peel (dafupi)*
*Bitter Orange (zhiqiao)* – stir-fried with bran after removing white pith
*Licorice (gancao)* – one *qian* each
*Scutellaria (huangqin)* – one *qian*
*Red Poria (chifuling)* – two *qian*, peeled
Cut. Add scallion white, decoct in one cup of water until seven-tenths remain, and take warm on an empty stomach.

**Severing Evil Elixir** – Treats *ghost fetus* in women, as if carrying a jar.
*Evodia (wuzhuyu)*
*Sichuan Aconite (chuanwu)*
*Large-Leaf Gentian (qinjiao)*
*Bupleurum (chaihu)*
*White Silkworm (baijiangcan)* – washed
*Morinda (baji)* – used raw
*Croton Seed (badou)* – husked but oil retained
*Genkwa Flower (yuanhua)* – boiled in vinegar, one *liang* each
Grind into powder, refine with honey into pills the size of *wutong* seeds. Take seven pills with honeyed wine to expel the malign matter and recover.

**Platycodon Powder** – Treats pregnancy with lung congestion, external wind-cold cough, wheezing, and dyspnea.
*Asparagus Root (tianmendong)* – one *liang*, heart removed
*Fritillaria (beimu)*
*Ginseng (renshen)*
*Licorice (gancao)*
*Mulberry Bark (sangbaipi)*
*Platycodon (jiegeng)*
*Perilla (zisuye)* – half a *liang* each
*Red Poria (chifuling)* – one *liang*
*Ephedra (mahuang)* – seven *qian*, nodes removed
Cut. For each dose, take four *qian*, decoct with three slices of ginger.
*Avoid carp while taking this formula.*

**Aster Decoction** – Treats pregnancy with unremitting cough and restless fetus.
*Aster (ziwan)*
*Asparagus Root (tianmendong)* – one *liang* each
*Platycodon (jiegeng)* – half a *liang*
*Licorice (gancao)*
*Mulberry Bark (sangbaipi)*
*Apricot Kernel (xingren)* – two and a half *qian* each
*Ledebouriella (fangfeng)* – half a *liang*
Cut. For each dose, take three *qian*, decoct with a piece of bamboo shavings. Strain, add half a spoonful of honey, and boil twice more before taking warm.

*Tangerine Peel (jupi)*
*White Atractylodes (baizhu)*
*Ophiopogon (maimendong)* – one *liang* each, heart removed
*Licorice (gancao)* – three *qian*
*Magnolia Bark (houpo)* – prepared with ginger
*White Poria (baifuling)* – half a *liang* each
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take four *qian*, add a piece of bamboo leaf the size of a bullet, and three slices of fresh ginger. Decoct and take on an empty stomach before meals.

**Augmented Four Agents Decoction** – Treats various *cold damage* (shanghan) conditions during pregnancy.
*Prepared Rehmannia (shudihuang)*
*Chinese Angelica (danggui)*
*Sichuan Lovage (chuanxiong)*
*Peony (shaoyao)* – equal parts

*If pregnancy with cold damage presents with inhibited urination, add poria and alisma.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage presents with urine as red as blood, add amber and poria.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage presents with stiff limbs, cold body, slight sweating, abdominal pain, and a deep, slow pulse, add blast-fried aconite (navel removed) and a small amount of cinnamon.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage presents with blood amassment syndrome, add raw rehmannia and wine-soaked rhubarb.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage presents with high fever, great thirst, steaming fever, and a long, large pulse, add gypsum and anemarrhena.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage, after purging, remains unresolved and develops warm toxin with rashes like brocade patterns, add cimicifuga and forsythia.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage, after purging, presents with unremitting cough, add ginseng and schisandra.*
*If pregnancy with cold damage, after purging, presents with vacuity glomus and abdominal fullness, add ginger-prepared magnolia bark and bran-fried unripe bitter orange.*

If pregnancy with cold damage, after purging, presents with insomnia, add gardenia and scutellaria.
If pregnancy with cold damage, after sweating, presents with unremitting blood leakage and damaged fetal qi, add ass-hide glue, honey-fried licorice, and astragalus.
If pregnancy presents with a floating pulse, head swelling, spontaneous diarrhea, and abdominal pain, remove rehmannia and add stir-fried cinnamon twig.
If pregnancy with cold damage presents with spontaneous diarrhea, abdominal pain, inability to eat, and a deep pulse, remove rehmannia and ligusticum, and add white atractylodes, honey-fried licorice, poria, and astragalus.

**Fetal Protection Methods for Treating Pregnancy with Cold Damage**
Grind an unspecified amount of *bai ya zi* into powder, mix with egg white, spread on paper the size of a bowl, and apply below the navel where the fetus resides. If it dries, moisten with warm water.
Another method: Mix hearth soil with water and apply below the navel; reapply when dry.
Another method: Shape into a pellet the size of a bullet and take orally—excellent.
Another method: For severe high fever, apply well-bottom mud to the area below the heart to protect the fetus.

**White Atractylodes Powder**
Treats pregnancy with cold damage, vexing heat, headache, fetal qi instability, or occasional vomiting with inability to eat.
*Ingredients:*
White atractylodes, tangerine peel, ginseng, peucedanum, ligusticum, ophiopogon (heart removed), red poria—each one *liang*; pinellia (washed in water, stir-fried), licorice—each half a *liang*.
*Preparation:* For each dose, take four *qian*, add four slices of ginger and two and a half *qian* of bamboo shavings, and decoct in water.

**Cimicifuga Powder**
Treats pregnancy with cold damage, headache, and high fever.
*Ingredients:*
Cimicifuga, stir-fried atractylodes, ophiopogon (heart removed), ephedra (nodes removed), gypsum—each one *liang*; scutellaria, anemarrhena—each five *qian*.
*Preparation:* For each dose, take four *qian*, add four slices of ginger and fourteen pieces of bamboo leaf, and decoct in water.

**Bupleurum Powder**
Treats pregnancy with cold damage, headache, stiff neck, fever, dry mouth, and chest and rib-side pain.
*Ingredients:*
Bupleurum, peucedanum, ligusticum, tangkuei, ginseng, peony, licorice, raw rehmannia—equal parts.
*Preparation:* Grind into fine powder. For each dose, take four *qian*, add three slices of ginger, three jujubes, and three stalks of scallion, and decoct in water until sweating occurs.

**Large Gentian Powder**
Treats pregnancy with cold damage lasting five or six days without sweating, dry mouth with excessive thirst, delirious speech, and vomiting.
*Ingredients:*
Large gentian, bupleurum—each one *liang*; gypsum—two *liang*; peucedanum, red poria, licorice nodes, pueraria, rhinoceros horn shavings, cimicifuga, scutellaria—each half a *liang*.
*Preparation:* For each dose, take four *qian*, add four slices of ginger and three *qian* of bamboo shavings, and decoct in water.

**Ledebouriella and Pueraria Decoction**
Treats pregnancy with wind strike, stiff back, and occasional opisthotonos.
*Ingredients:*
Ledebouriella, pueraria, ligusticum, raw rehmannia—each two *liang*; apricot kernel (processed)—one and a half *liang*; ephedra (nodes removed)—one and a half *liang*; stir-fried cinnamon bark, angelica, licorice, stephania—each one *liang*.
*Preparation:* Chop and take four *qian* per dose, decoct in water.

**Treatment for Pregnancy with Wind Strike**
For opisthotonos, lockjaw, slurred speech—called wind tetany or *zi xian* (eclampsia).
*Ingredients:*
Ephedra (nodes removed), ledebouriella, angelica—each one *liang*; stir-fried cinnamon bark, cimicifuga, licorice, antelope horn shavings, sour jujube kernel, large gentian—each half a *liang*; ligusticum, tangkuei, apricot kernel (processed)—each seven *qian*.
*Preparation:* Chop and take four *qian* per dose, add four slices of ginger and one *ge* of bamboo sap, and decoct in water.

**Treatment for Eclampsia Near Delivery**
For sudden loss of consciousness, vomiting, dizziness, and fainting near term due to wind tetany—called *zi xian*.
*Ingredients:*
Pueraria, fritillaria (heart removed), moutan bark, stephania, ledebouriella, tangkuei, ligusticum, licorice, alisma, white poria, stir-fried cinnamon bark—each two *liang*; angelica, gypsum, ginseng—each three *liang*.
*Preparation:* Chop, decoct nine *sheng* of water down to three *sheng*, and divide into two doses.
*Fritillaria facilitates easy delivery; if not near term, substitute with cimicifuga.*

**Bupleurum Powder for Pregnancy Malaria**
*Ingredients:*
Bupleurum—two *qian*; raw rhubarb—two *qian*; scutellaria—one and a half *qian*; licorice—one *qian*.
*Preparation:* Chop and decoct in water as a single dose. Take warm at dawn on the day of onset; purging indicates recovery.
If the fetus presses upward against the heart, take *zhi qiao* powder and avoid oily, flour-based, acrid, and hot foods.

**Another Formula**
*Ingredients:*
Rhubarb—two *liang*; bupleurum—one and a half *liang*; scutellaria, peony—each one *liang*.
*Preparation:* Grind into fine powder, form into pills with clear water and flour the size of *tong* seeds. Take one hundred pills at dawn on the day of onset with cold water; two hours later, take fifty more pills until purging occurs.

**Treatment for Pregnancy Malaria with Fever, Dry Mouth, and Unquenchable Thirst**
*Ingredients:*
Raw rehmannia—one and a half *liang*; scutellaria, ophiopogon (heart removed), ginseng, anemarrhena—each one *liang*; gypsum—two *liang*; licorice—half a *liang*; dried pueraria—one *liang*.
*Preparation:* Chop and take five *qian* per dose, add half a mume, and decoct.

**Effective Formula for Pregnancy Malaria**
*Ingredients:*
Dichroa root, gypsum—each one *liang*; honey-fried licorice, scutellaria—each half a *liang*; mume—seven pieces.
*Preparation:* Finely chop, soak overnight in one bowl each of wine and water, decoct in the morning down to one bowl, strain, and divide into two doses. Take on the day of onset.

**Fetal Verification Formula**
For women whose menstruation has ceased for three months.
*Ingredients:*
Ligusticum (unheated).
*Preparation:* Grind into fine powder. Take one *fang cun bi* on an empty stomach with a thick decoction of mugwort. If slight movement is felt in the abdomen, pregnancy is confirmed.

chunks.translated_text:
**Formulas for Difficult Childbirth and Related Ailments**

**Zhiqiao Powder**
For women nearing childbirth; taking this formula ensures a smooth and easy delivery by thinning the fetus.
*Ingredients:*
Bitter orange peel—four *liang* (each stir-fried with wheat bran); raw licorice—two *liang*.
*Preparation:* Grind into fine powder. Take one to two *qian* per dose, mixed with plain hot water.

**For Premature Labor with Pain Before Full Term**
Grind calamus root to extract its juice and pour into the throat.

*Alternative Formula:*
Take evodia fruit the size of a jujube, mixed with well-drawn water.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind three *liang* of anemarrhena into powder, form into honey pills the size of *tung* seeds. Take twenty pills per dose with rice water.

**Rusheng Powder**
For difficult labor.
*Ingredients:*
Perilla leaves, Chinese angelica—equal parts.
*Preparation:* Take three to five *qian* per dose, decoct in flowing water. If no flowing water is available, stir water in one direction before decocting.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind one hundred yellow mallow seeds into a paste. Take with wine or water; delivery will follow immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind one *cun* of high-quality inkstick into powder, mix with water, and take; delivery will follow immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Take a five-*cun* segment of the husband’s undergarment belt, burn to ash (retaining its nature), and take with wine.

*Alternative Formula:*
Have the woman hold two castor beans, one in each hand; the fetus will descend.

*Alternative Formula:*
Have the pregnant woman hold a branch from the east side of a pagoda tree; delivery will be easy.

*Alternative Formula:*
Swallow two gleditsia seeds; delivery will follow immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Swallow seven pagoda tree seeds with freshly drawn water; delivery will follow immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind a small amount of gleditsia into powder and blow into the nose to induce sneezing; the child will be born.

*Alternative Formula:*
Decoct perilla leaves, mix with *Yiyuan Powder*, and take; delivery will follow immediately.

**For Women in Prolonged Labor with Exhausted Qi and Unproductive Delivery, or When Lochia is Exhausted and the Placenta Remains Dry**
Boil one *dou* of adzuki beans in nine *sheng* of water until soft, strain, and dissolve three *liang* of donkey-hide gelatin in the bean broth. Take half a small cup per dose. If delivery does not occur, take another dose; the fetus will be expelled.

**For Women Who Fail to Deliver After Five to Seven Days, or for Short-Statured Women with Unopened Pubic Symphysis**
Take the shell of a naturally deceased snail or discarded divination shell, stir-fry with butter or soak in vinegar and then stir-fry. Alternatively, take a handful of hair from a woman who has borne many sons and daughters, burn to ash (retaining its nature), and decoct with Chinese angelica and ligusticum. This formula is highly effective; the fetus—whether alive or dead—will be expelled within the time it takes to walk five *li*.

**Wushe Powder**
For breech presentation.
*Ingredients:*
Black snake slough—one; cicada slough—fourteen; fetal hair—one.
*Preparation:* Burn the three ingredients to ash, divide into two doses, and take with warm wine. After taking both doses, lie supine briefly; the child will turn and be born naturally.

*Alternative Formula:*
Prick the sole of the child’s foot three to five times with a fine needle, then apply a small amount of salt to the pricked area; the child will turn naturally. Using a grain husk for pricking is especially effective.

*Alternative Formula:*
Apply salt to the child’s soles, or scratch them with fingernails. Also, rub the mother’s abdomen with salt.

*Alternative Formula:*
Use the middle finger to take soot from the bottom of a wok and draw intersecting lines on the child’s soles; the child will turn naturally.

*Alternative Formula:*
Write the father’s name on the child’s soles; the child will turn naturally.

**For Transverse Presentation Preventing Delivery**
Grind plantago seeds into powder. Take two *qian bi* with wine.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind dodder seeds into powder. Take one *qian bi* with wine or rice water.

**Effective Formula for Transverse or Breech Presentation**
*Ingredients:*
Soot from burned grasses, dahurian angelica—equal parts (unheated).
*Preparation:* Mix one *ge* each of boy’s urine and good vinegar into a paste, then steep in boiling water and take. In severe cases, two doses will induce delivery.

**For Transverse or Breech Presentation with Fetal Death in Utero**
First, stir-fry one *ge* of black soybeans until fragrant, then decoct with water and boy’s urine; highly effective.

*Alternative Formula:*
Boil half a *jin* of mugwort leaves in four *sheng* of wine until reduced to one *sheng*; take.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind Chinese angelica into powder. Take one *fang cun bi* with wine or perilla decoction.

**Duoming Powder**
For fetal death in utero with failure to deliver.
*Ingredients:*
Cinnamon—two *qian*; musk—one *dangmenzi* grain.
*Preparation:* Grind into powder and take with wine; the fetus will be expelled shortly.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind three to five *fang cun bi* of deer antler shavings, decoct with scallion and fermented soybean broth, and take; the fetus will be expelled immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Boil one *liang* of cinnabar in water for several boils, grind into powder, and take with wine; effective.

*Alternative Formula:*
Boil elm bark to extract its juice; take two *sheng* to expel the fetus.

*Alternative Formula:*
Grind hearth soil into powder. Take three *qian bi* with water; the soil will emerge with the child.

*Alternative Formula:*
Boil two *liang* of fringed pink in eight *sheng* of water until reduced to three *sheng*. Take one *sheng*; if the fetus is not expelled, take another dose.

*Alternative Formula:*
Take two *qian* of mirabilite, mix with warm boy’s urine, and take. Also treats retained placenta; immediately effective.

*Alternative Formula:*
Remove the shells from one hundred castor beans, grind with two *qian* of realgar powder into a paste, spread on paper, and apply to the mother’s right sole. Place a bowl of cold water nearby; remove the paste immediately upon delivery. Also treats retained placenta.

**For Women Who Die in Childbirth with the Fetus Undelivered**
Use mercury the size of a pellet, pry open the mouth, and pour it in. Support the woman to sit briefly, then help her stand; the child will be expelled.

**Secret Formula for Retained Placenta**
Cover the wellhead with the mother’s undergarment; the placenta will be expelled immediately.

*Alternative Formula:*
Boil rice, wheat, and adzuki beans together into a thick broth and take; immediately effective.

**Additional Remedies**

Another remedy: Use *suhexiang wan* (Storax Pill), decocted in boy’s urine for one or two boils, then taken mixed in the decoction.

**For Postpartum Blood Fainting with Loss of Consciousness and Cessation of Heart Qi**
Extract juice from *xiakucao* (selfheal) and administer one cup; highly effective.

Another remedy: Take two *liang* of *wulingzhi* (flying squirrel droppings), half raw and half stir-fried, ground into fine powder. Administer one *qian* per dose mixed with warm wine. For clenched jaw, pry open the mouth to administer. Adding equal parts *jingjie* (schizonepeta) to the powder and taking it mixed with warm boy’s urine is even more effective.

Another remedy: Divide one *liang* of *honghua* (safflower) into two doses. Decoct in one cup each of wine and boy’s urine until reduced to one cup, then administer.

Another remedy: Grind one *liang* of *banxia* (pinellia) into powder, mix with cold water to form pills the size of soybeans, and insert into the nostrils; immediate relief.

Another remedy: Grind *jingmo* (capital inkstick) with vinegar and administer; highly effective.

**For Postpartum Blood Fainting with Heart Affliction, Stiff Neck, Delirium, Cessation of Qi, Restless Limbs, and Uncontrolled Chills and Fever**
Stir-fry *yanhusuo* (corydalis) into powder and take one *qianbi* with wine. Also treats retained foul sweat and abdominal distension.

Another remedy: Chop two *liang* of *xuduanpi* (teasel root bark), decoct in three *sheng* of water until reduced to one *sheng*, divide into three doses, and take warm. Administer the next dose after the time it takes to walk two or three *li*. No contraindications; even those near death will recover.

Another remedy: One cup of fresh *shengdihuang* (rehmannia) juice, two and a half *qian* each of *danggui* (Chinese angelica) and *chishaoyao* (red peony). Decoct in water for three to five boils and take warm. If restlessness or heat is felt, omit *danggui* and add half a cup of boy’s urine before administering.

**For Postpartum Putrid Blood Attacking the Heart, Fever, Delirious Speech, and Restlessness (with a Weak and Large Pulse)**
*Ganheye* (dried lotus leaf), *shengdihuang* (fresh rehmannia), and *mudanpi* (tree peony bark) in equal parts. Decoct and mix with two *qianbi* of *puhuang* (cattail pollen) for one dose; immediate relief.

**For Postpartum Putrid Blood Attacking the Heart, Retained Placenta, and Abdominal Blood Clots**
Grind one *liang* of *jinwen dahuang* (high-quality rhubarb) into fine powder, decoct with half a *sheng* of strong vinegar into a paste, and form pills the size of *tongzi* (tung seeds). Dissolve five to seven pills in seven parts of a cup of vinegar and administer; prompt expulsion.

**For Postpartum Blood Ascending to the Heart (Already Dead or Retained Fetus)**
Burn *yujin* (turmeric) to preserve its properties, grind into powder, and administer two *qian* per dose mixed with one *ge* of strong vinegar; immediate revival.

**For Postpartum Putrid Blood Attacking the Heart, Chest Fullness, Labored Breathing, and Imminent Death**
If true *xuejie* (dragon’s blood) is unavailable, substitute *zikuang* (purple ore). Combine with *moyao* (myrrh) in equal parts, grind gently into fine powder, and administer two *qian* per dose. Decoct in half a large cup of boy’s urine mixed with wine for one boil, then take warm. Administer immediately after delivery, and again after resting in bed for a while.

**For Postpartum Qi Panting (Considered Incurable Due to Isolated Yang and Extinguished Yin)**
One *liang* each of *renshen* (ginseng) and *sumu* (sappan wood). For each dose, decoct five *qian* in two cups of water until reduced to seven parts, and sip frequently.

Another remedy: Use *hutao rou* (walnut meat), leaving the skin intact, combined with equal parts *renshen* (ginseng). For each dose, decoct five *qian* in one and a half cups of water until reduced to seven parts, and sip frequently; repeatedly effective.

**Cang Gong Powder**
Treats postpartum depression, blood syncope, closed eyes, and silence. First induce sneezing with *Cang Gong Powder*, then administer *Baiwei Decoction*.
*Tianguadi* (muskmelon pedicel), *lilu* (black false hellebore), *xionghuang* (realgar), and *mingfan* (calcined alum) in equal parts. Grind into fine powder and insufflate into the nostrils.

**Baiwei Decoction**
*Baiwei* (swallowwort root) and *danggui* (Chinese angelica), one *liang* each; *renshen* (ginseng), half a *liang*; *gancao* (licorice), two and a half *qian*. For each dose, decoct four *qian* in water and take warm.

**Gu Feng Powder**
Treats postpartum closed eyes and inability to speak.
One *qian* of *baifan* (white alum). Grind into fine powder and administer mixed with boiled water.

chunks.original_text: 治产后血不下。 夏枯草绞汁，每服一小盏，入酒一合，温搅匀服。 又方，蒲黄三两，水三升，煎取一升，顿服。 治妇人产后败血未尽，心腹胀满。 生姜切，五两 右以水五升，煮三升，分三服，立效。 治产后血癖痛。 大黄一两 当归半两 官桂二钱 右以酒三升，煮十沸，顿服。 治产后恶物不尽，腹内疼痛。 生乾地黄一两，微炒 当归一两，微炒 生姜半两，瓦上炒焦黑 右以为细末，每服二钱，姜酒调服，神效。 治产后心腹痛，欲死。 五灵脂 蒲黄各等分 右为末，先用酽醋调二钱，熬膏，入水半盏、童便半盏，煎七分，食前热服，神效。 治产后腹中绞痛不可忍。 延胡索 当归 芍药 川芎 乾姜各等分 右为细末，每服三钱，温酒调下。 治产后恶露不尽，腰腹痛、儿枕痛并皆治之。 延胡索 桂心 当归各等分 右为细末，每服三钱，热酒调服。 治产后内虚，寒气入腹，腹中绞痛，及两胁当脐急痛，名曰寒疝。 肥羊肉一斤 当归 甘草 芍药炒 人参各一两 右□咀，以水一斗，先煮取七升，入药更煮再二升，去滓，分二服。 治产后血瘕痛，脐下胀，不下食。 当归二两 桂心 芍药各半两 蒲黄各一两半 血碣 延胡索各一两 胁肋胀，去血碣，加槟榔、柴胡、青木香。 右为细末，每服二钱，温酒调下。 治产后血入於肺，面黑发喘，欲死者。 人参一两，另为末 苏合香二两 右以水二碗，煮苏合香至一碗，去滓，调参末随多少，如神效。 治产后恶露不下，三四日呕逆、壮热。 芍药二两半　知母　生姜　当归　蒲黄各二两　红花五钱　生地黄汁一盏　荷叶中心蒂七个 右以水二升，煎至一升，去滓，下蒲黄煎四沸，空心分作三服。 治产后呕吐不止。 陈皮一两　半夏曲　甘草各半两　藿香二两 右为细末，每服三钱，姜三片，煎热服。 趁痛散，治产后气弱，血滞，身热，头疼及遍身疼痛。 牛膝　当归　桂心　白术　黄耆　独活　生姜各半两　甘草炙　薤白各二钱半 右□咀，每服半两，水三盏煎至盏半，去滓，食前热服。 治产后头痛。 川芎　当归　荆芥穗各等分 右□咀，每服五钱，水煎热服。 治产后下血不止。 炙桑白皮煮水饮之，良。 又方，菖蒲二两，以酒二升煮，分作两服止。 治产后下血，虚赢殆死。 蒲黄二两，水二升，煮取八合，顿服。 治产后子宫不收。 荆芥穗　藿香叶　□椿树皮各等分 右煎汤熏之，子宫即入。 又方，五倍子、白矾为末，温汤泡洗。 又方，萆麻子捣涂顶心，吸入即洗去药。 治产后生肠不收。 枳壳煎汤温浸，良久即入。 治产后阴下脱。 蛇床子绢袋盛蒸熨之，亦治阴户痛。 又方，顺火草一斤，阴乾，水五升煮取汁，分温服。 又方，以铁炉中紫尘、羊脂二味搅令稠，布裹炙热熨，推纳之差。 治产后阴道开不闭。 以石灰一斗，炒黄，水三斗投灰中，放冷，澄清，取一斗二升，暖洗，又治阴肠脱出。 治产后中风寒，遍身冷直，口噤不识人。 白术三两　川芎　当归　生姜各一两 右以酒三升，煎取一升，顿服。 治产后中风，语涩，四肢拘急。 羌活三两　当归一两　官桂半两　杏仁半两，去皮尖，炒 右为末，每服五钱，酒水各半盏煎，去滓，温服。 治产后中风，烦渴。 红花五合微炒，水一升，煎取七合，徐徐呷之。

**For postpartum retention of blood.**
Extract juice from *xiakucao* (selfheal), take one small cup per dose, mix with one *ge* of wine, stir well, and take warm. *Alternative formula:* Three *liang* of *puhuang* (cattail pollen), decoct in three *sheng* of water to reduce to one *sheng*, and take in one dose.

**For postpartum residual stagnant blood causing abdominal distension and fullness.**
Five *liang* of fresh ginger, sliced. Decoct in five *sheng* of water to reduce to three *sheng*, divide into three doses, and take. Instantly effective.

**For postpartum blood stasis pain.**
One *liang* of *dahuang* (rhubarb), half a *liang* of *danggui* (Chinese angelica), and two *qian* of *guangui* (cassia bark). Decoct in three *sheng* of wine for ten boils and take in one dose.

**For postpartum retention of lochia causing abdominal pain.**
One *liang* of *shenggandihuang* (dried rehmannia), lightly stir-fried; one *liang* of *danggui*, lightly stir-fried; half a *liang* of fresh ginger, stir-fried on a tile until charred black. Grind into fine powder, take two *qian* per dose mixed with ginger wine. Divinely effective.

**For excruciating postpartum heart and abdominal pain.**
Equal parts *wulingzhi* (flying squirrel feces) and *puhuang*. Grind into powder, first mix two *qian* with strong vinegar to form a paste, then add half a cup of water and half a cup of boy’s urine, decoct to seven parts, and take warm before meals. Divinely effective.

**For unbearable postpartum colicky abdominal pain.**
Equal parts *yanhusuo* (corydalis), *danggui*, *shaoyao* (peony), *chuanxiong* (Sichuan lovage), and *ganjiang* (dried ginger). Grind into fine powder, take three *qian* per dose mixed with warm wine.

**For postpartum retention of lochia, lumbar and abdominal pain, and childbed pain.**
Equal parts *yanhusuo*, *guixin* (cassia heartwood), and *danggui*. Grind into fine powder, take three *qian* per dose mixed with hot wine.

**For postpartum internal deficiency, cold qi entering the abdomen causing colicky pain, and acute pain around the navel and flanks (known as cold mounting).**
One *jin* of fatty mutton, one *liang* each of *danggui*, *gancao* (licorice), stir-fried *shaoyao*, and *renshen* (ginseng). Chop coarsely, first boil the mutton in one *dou* of water to reduce to seven *sheng*, then add the herbs and decoct to two *sheng*. Strain and divide into two doses.

**For postpartum blood conglomeration causing pain below the navel and abdominal distension with loss of appetite.**
Two *liang* of *danggui*, half a *liang* each of *guixin* and *shaoyao*, one and a half *liang* of *puhuang*, one *liang* each of *xuejie* (dragon’s blood) and *yanhusuo*. For flank distension, omit *xuejie* and add *binglang* (areca nut), *chaihu* (bupleurum), and *qingmuxiang* (costus root). Grind into fine powder, take two *qian* per dose mixed with warm wine.

**For postpartum blood invading the lungs causing dark complexion, panting, and near-death.**
One *liang* of *renshen*, ground separately into powder; two *liang* of *suhexiang* (storax). Decoct the *suhexiang* in two bowls of water to reduce to one bowl, strain, and mix with the *renshen* powder as needed. Divinely effective.

**For postpartum retention of lochia, vomiting, and high fever three to four days after delivery.**
Two and a half *liang* of *shaoyao*, two *liang* each of *zhimu* (anemarrhena), fresh ginger, *danggui*, and *puhuang*, five *qian* of *honghua* (safflower), and one cup of fresh *dihuang* (rehmannia) juice, with seven lotus receptacle centers. Decoct in two *sheng* of water to reduce to one *sheng*, strain, add *puhuang*, and decoct for four more boils. Divide into three doses and take on an empty stomach.

**For incessant postpartum vomiting.**
One *liang* of *chenpi* (aged tangerine peel), half a *liang* each of *banxiaqu* (pinellia fermentata) and *gancao*, and two *liang* of *huoxiang* (patchouli). Grind into fine powder, take three *qian* per dose with three slices of ginger, and decoct for a hot serving.

**Chasing Pain Powder**
Treats postpartum qi deficiency, blood stagnation, fever, headache, and generalized pain.
Half a *liang* each of *niuxi* (achyranthes), *danggui*, *guixin*, *baizhu* (atractylodes), *huangqi* (astragalus), *duhuo* (angelica pubescens), and fresh ginger; two and a half *qian* each of roasted *gancao* and *xiebai* (Chinese garlic chives). Chop coarsely, take half a *liang* per dose, decoct in three cups of water to reduce to one and a half cups, strain, and take warm before meals.

**For postpartum headache.**
Equal parts *chuanxiong*, *danggui*, and *jingjiesui* (schizonepeta spike). Chop coarsely, take five *qian* per dose, and decoct in water for a hot serving.

**For incessant postpartum bleeding.**
Boil roasted *sangbaipi* (mulberry root bark) in water and drink. Effective.
*Alternative formula:* Two *liang* of *changpu* (calamus), decoct in two *sheng* of wine, and divide into two doses to stop bleeding.

**For postpartum bleeding causing extreme debility and near-death.**
Two *liang* of *puhuang*, decoct in two *sheng* of water to reduce to eight *ge*, and take in one dose.

**For postpartum prolapse of the uterus.**
Equal parts *jingjiesui*, *huoxiangye* (patchouli leaf), and *chunshupi* (toona bark). Decoct in water and use the steam to fumigate; the uterus will retract.
*Alternative formula:* Grind *wubeizi* (gallnut) and *baifan* (white alum) into powder, steep in warm water, and wash.
*Alternative formula:* Apply mashed *bimazi* (castor bean) to the crown of the head; once the uterus retracts, wash off the medicine.

**For postpartum prolapse of the intestines.**
Decoct *zhiqiao* (bitter orange) in water and soak in the warm liquid for a long time; the intestines will retract.

**For postpartum vaginal prolapse.**
Fill a silk pouch with *shechuangzi* (cnidium seed) and steam to apply as a hot compress. Also treats vaginal pain.
*Alternative formula:* One *jin* of *shunhuocao* (purslane), dry in the shade, decoct in five *sheng* of water to obtain the juice, and take warm in divided doses.
*Alternative formula:* Mix *zichen* (purple dust from an iron furnace) and *yangzhi* (mutton fat) until thick, wrap in cloth, heat, and apply as a hot compress to push and reposition the prolapse.

**For postpartum vaginal laxity and failure to close.**
Stir-fry one *dou* of lime until yellow, add three *dou* of water, let cool, and allow to settle. Take one *dou* and two *sheng* of the clear liquid, warm, and wash. Also treats prolapse of the vaginal canal.

**For postpartum wind-cold invasion causing generalized cold rigidity, lockjaw, and loss of consciousness.**
Three *liang* of *baizhu* (atractylodes), one *liang* each of *chuanxiong*, *danggui*, and fresh ginger. Decoct in three *sheng* of wine to reduce to one *sheng* and take in one dose.

**For postpartum wind invasion causing slurred speech and tetanic spasms of the limbs.**
Three *liang* of *qianghuo* (notopterygium), one *liang* of *danggui*, half a *liang* of *guangui*, and half a *liang* of *xingren* (apricot kernel), peeled and stir-fried. Grind into powder, take five *qian* per dose, decoct in half a cup each of wine and water, strain, and take warm.

**For postpartum wind invasion causing vexation and thirst.**
Lightly stir-fry five *ge* of *honghua*, decoct in one *sheng* of water to reduce to seven *ge*, and sip slowly.

chunks.original_text: 治产后中风，不省人事，口吐涎沬，手足瘈疭。 当归　荆芥穗各等分 右为细末，每服三钱，水一盏，入酒煎七分，灌之。 口噤者，斡开灌。 小续命汤，治产后中风，腰强直，时时反张，或半身不遂，口眼喎斜，手足战掉，语言蹇涩。 防己　肉桂去皮　黄苓　芍药　杏仁去皮尖　甘草　川芎　麻黄去根节　人参各一两　防风一两半　附子去皮脐，半两 右□咀，每服五钱，水一盏，姜五片，枣一枚，煎七分，热服。 若藏寒下利者，去防己、黄苓，加白术、附子一倍。 若自汗者，去麻黄、杏仁，加白术、黄耆。 若失音者，加杏仁一倍。 治产后中风，手足不遂，语言蹇涩，恍惚多忘，精神不定。 独活　当归　芍药　防风　川芎　玄参　天麻各五钱　桂心三钱 若作丸，已上皆加分两。 右□咀，以水八升，煮取二升半，分为三服，亦可蜜丸服。 若有气证，加生姜一两半； 若有热，加葛根五两； 冷加白术五两； 若手足不稳，加牛膝一两二钱、萆#1薢三两、黄耆四两。 治产后血渴不止。 一方用黄苓、麦门冬去心，等分煎服。 延胡索　蔚金　乾葛　桂心　青皮　枳壳麸炒，各等分 右并以好醋浸一宿，焙乾为细末，每服二钱，冷橘皮汤调下。 又方，生地黄汁和蜜微炼过，熟水温调服，即止。 竹叶汤，治产后虚渴少气。 竹叶三升　甘草　人参　茯苓各一两　小麦五合　生姜　半夏各三两　麦门冬去心，五两　大枣十五枚 右□咀，以水九升，先煮竹叶、小麦、生姜、枣，取七升，去滓，纳药再煎，取三升，去滓，一服五合，日三服，夜一服。 益元散，治产后虚渴，煎人参、五味子、麦门冬去心，汤调服，良。 治产后小便数及遗尿。 桑螵蛸半两，炙　龙骨一两 右为细末，米饮调下二钱，空心服。

**For postpartum wind invasion causing loss of consciousness, foaming at the mouth, and convulsive spasms of the hands and feet.**
Equal parts *danggui* (tangkuei) and *jingjiesui* (schizonepeta spike). Grind into fine powder, take three *qian* per dose, decoct in one cup of water with a splash of wine to reduce to seven *fen*, and administer by pouring. If the jaw is locked, pry it open to pour the decoction.

**Minor Continued Life Decoction (*Xiao Xuming Tang*), for postpartum wind invasion causing rigidity of the waist, opisthotonos, hemiplegia, facial distortion, tremors of the hands and feet, and slurred speech.**
One *liang* each of *fangji* (stephania), *rougui* (cassia bark, peeled), *huangqin* (scutellaria), *shaoyao* (peony), *xingren* (apricot kernel, peeled), *gancao* (licorice), *chuanxiong* (ligusticum), and *mahuang* (ephedra, root and nodes removed); one and a half *liang* of *fangfeng* (saposhnikovia); half a *liang* of *fuzi* (aconite, peeled). □□, take five *qian* per dose, decoct in one cup of water with five slices of ginger and one jujube, reduce to seven *fen*, and take warm.
If there is visceral cold with diarrhea, remove *fangji* and *huangqin*, and double the *baizhu* (atractylodes) and *fuzi*.
If there is spontaneous sweating, remove *mahuang* and *xingren*, and add *baizhu* and *huangqi* (astragalus).
If there is loss of voice, double the *xingren*.

**For postpartum wind invasion causing hemiplegia, slurred speech, absentmindedness, forgetfulness, and mental instability.**
Five *qian* each of *duhuo* (angelica pubescens), *danggui*, *shaoyao*, *fangfeng*, *chuanxiong*, *xuanshen* (scrophularia), and *tianma* (gastrodia); three *qian* of *guixin* (cassia heartwood). If making pills, increase the above quantities proportionally. □□, decoct in eight *sheng* of water to reduce to two and a half *sheng*, divide into three doses. May also be taken as honeyed pills.
If there are signs of qi deficiency, add one and a half *liang* of fresh ginger.
If there is heat, add five *liang* of *gegen* (pueraria).
If there is cold, add five *liang* of *baizhu*.
If the hands and feet are unsteady, add one *liang* two *qian* of *niuxi* (achyranthes), three *liang* of *bixie* (dioscorea), and four *liang* of *huangqi*.

**For incessant postpartum blood thirst.**
One formula uses equal parts *huangqin* (scutellaria) and *maimendong* (ophiopogon, heart removed), decocted and taken.
Equal parts *yanhusuo* (corydalis), *yujin* (curcuma), *gan’ge* (pueraria), *guixin*, *qingpi* (unripe tangerine peel), and *zhiqiao* (bitter orange, bran-fried). Soak all in good vinegar overnight, dry, grind into fine powder, take two *qian* per dose, and take with cold tangerine peel decoction.

Half a *liang* of *sangpiaoxiao* (mantis egg-case, roasted); one *liang* of *longgu* (dragon bone). Grind into fine powder, take two *qian* per dose with rice water on an empty stomach.

**Another formula:** Burn chicken droppings to ash, take one *fangcunbi* on an empty stomach with wine. **For postpartum constipation or urinary retention, or bloody discharge.**

*Cheqianzi* (plantago seed), *huangqin* (scutellaria), *puhuang* (cattail pollen), *muli* (oyster shell), *shengdihuang* (fresh rehmannia), and *shaoyao* (peony) – one *liang* each. Grind into fine powder, take one *fangcunbi* on an empty stomach with rice water. **Avoid wheat and garlic.**

*Shaoyao* (peony), *danggui* (tangkuei), and *zhizi* (gardenia) – five *qian* each; *xiangchi* (fermented soybean) – half a *ge*. □□, decoct one *liang* per dose in water and take.

*Chaihu* (bupleurum) – two *liang*; *huangqin* (scutellaria) – seven *qian*; *renshen* (ginseng) – five *qian*; *banxia* (pinellia, washed in hot water) – one and a half *liang*; *gancao* (licorice) – seven and a half *qian*; three jujubes; *shengdihuang* (fresh rehmannia), *zhizi* (gardenia), and *zhiqiao* (bitter orange peel, stir-fried with bran) – five *qian* each. □□, decoct one *liang* per dose with five slices of ginger, and take warm.

**Bupleurum Powder (*Chaihu San*), for postpartum deficiency and emaciation, with chills and fever, poor appetite, and abdominal distension (adjust dosages as needed).**
Equal parts *chaihu* (bupleurum), *renshen* (ginseng), *gancao* (licorice), *banxia* (pinellia, washed in hot water), *chenpi* (tangerine peel), *chuanxiong* (ligusticum), and *baishaoyao* (white peony). □□, decoct five *qian* per dose with five slices of ginger and two jujubes, and take after meals. **For cough, add *sangbaipi* (mulberry root bark) and *digupi* (wolfberry root bark).**

**For postpartum incessant bleeding.**
Take three chicken eggs, half a *sheng* of vinegar, and two *sheng* of good wine; decoct to reduce to one *sheng*, divide into four doses, and take warm after walking two or three *li*.

**For postpartum incessant white diarrhea.**
Half a *liang* of *aiye* (mugwort, roasted hot) and half a *liang* of old fresh ginger. Decoct in water and take to stop.

**Divine-Efficacy Formula for postpartum dysentery.**
Pound *canger* leaves (xanthium) to extract juice, mix with honey, and take half a cup warm, three times daily.

**Scutellaria Pill (*Huangqin Wan*), for postpartum red and white dysentery with unbearable colicky abdominal pain.**
*Ejiao* (ass hide glue), *puhuang* (cattail pollen), and *zhiziren* (gardenia seed) – #2 *liang* each; *huanglian* (coptis) – four *liang*; *danggui* (tangkuei) – one and a half *liang*; *huangbo* (phellodendron) – three *liang*; *huangqin* (scutellaria) and *shaoyao* (peony) – two *liang* each. Grind into fine powder, form into pills with refined honey the size of *tongzi* seeds, and take sixty pills per dose with rice water, three times during the day and once at night.

**Another formula:**
*Shaoyao* (peony), *ejiao* (ass hide glue), *aiye* (mugwort), *shudihuang* (prepared rehmannia), *gancao* (licorice), and *danggui* (tangkuei) – four *liang* each. □□, decoct one *liang* per dose in water and take. **For critical cases, use the above dosages for a single dose.** Boil in three *sheng* of water to reduce to one *sheng*, divide into two doses, and take on an empty stomach. Called *Emergency Powder*.

**Another formula:**
*Shaoyao* (peony) – three *qian*; *huangqin* (scutellaria) – two and a half *qian*; *danggui* (tangkuei) – two *qian*; *gancao* (licorice) – one and a half *qian*. □□, decoct in one *sheng* of water to reduce to seven *fen*, and take warm before meals. **For tenesmus, add *zhiqiao* (bitter orange peel) and *binglang* (areca nut).**

**For postpartum incessant deficiency sweating.**
Equal parts *danggui* (tangkuei), *huangqi* (astragalus), *mahuanggen* (ephedra root), *muli* (oyster shell, calcined to powder), *renshen* (ginseng), and *fengcao* (licorice, roasted). □□, decoct five *qian* per dose in one cup of water and take warm.

**Another formula:**
Equal parts *muli* (oyster shell, calcined) and *xiaomaifu* (wheat bran, stir-fried yellow). Grind into fine powder, and take two *qian* per dose with boiled fresh pork broth at any time.

Half a *liang* of *guixin* (cinnamon heart) and three *ge* of fresh ginger. Decoct together to reduce to two *ge*, first warm the back with fire, then apply and rub the medicine until absorbed. **Excellent.**

**For postpartum menstrual irregularity, restlessness in the limbs, poor appetite, and gradual emaciation.**
*Hupo* (amber), *niuxi* (achyranthes), *shengdihuang* (fresh rehmannia), and *danggui* (tangkuei) – one *liang* each; *taoren* (peach kernel) and *chishaoyao* (red peony) – half a *liang* each. Two *liang* of *wuyao* (lindera); one *liang* each of *danggui* (tangkuei) and *ewu* (zedoary). Grind into fine powder, take two *qian* per dose with warm wine, and eat afterward. **Strictly avoid raw, cold, and greasy foods.**

chunks.original_text: 四物汤 熟地黄　川芎　芍药　当归各等分 右为粗末，水煎服。 若女蒸劳热，加地骨皮、牡丹皮、知母、柴胡、黄苓。 若妊娠胎动不安，下血不止者，加艾十叶、阿胶、黄耆、葱。 若血脏虚冷，崩中去血过多，亦加胶、艾。 若血崩者，加生地黄、蒲黄、黄苓，一加阿大艾、黄苓。 若血虚而腹痛微汗，而恶风，加莪术、官桂。 若风虚眩运，加秦艽、羌活。 若气虚弱，起则无力，眶然而倒，加厚朴、陈皮。 若发热而烦，不得睡卧，加黄连、栀子。 若虚寒脉微，自汗，气难布息，清便自调，加乾姜、附子炮。 若中湿，身沉重无力，身凉微汗，加白术、茯苓。 若筋骨肢#1节痛，及头痛增寒，加羌活、防风、稿本、细辛。 若脐下虚冷，腹痛及腰脊间闷痛，加玄胡索、苦练各炒。 若经水过多，别无余证，加黄苓、白术。 若经水涩少，加葵花、红花。 若虚劳气弱，咳嗽喘满，加姜制厚朴、麸炒枳实。 若经水暴下，加黄苓。 若血积块痛，加莪术、三棱、桂、乾漆炒。 若赤白带下，加香附子、桂炒。 若血痢，加胶、艾、黄连。 若产后血痢，腹痛疼，加槐花、黄连、御米壳。 若血热相搏#2，舌乾口渴，加栝蒌、麦门冬。 若大渴引饮，加石膏、知母。 若藏府秘涩，加大黄、桃仁。 若呕吐者，加白术、人参、藿香、生姜。 若虚寒滑泄者，加官桂、附子炮。 若虚烦不得睡，加竹叶、人参、酸枣仁。 若目赤，暴发作云翳，疼痛不可忍，加防风、羌活、防己酒浸、草龙胆酒浸。 芎归汤 川芎　当归各等分 右□咀，水煎热服。 若产后眩运，加芍药、甘菊花。 若产后腹痛，加官桂，酒、童便合煎。 若妊娠子死，或不死胎动，加紫苏，酒、水合煎，死者即下，未死者即安。 若临月服之，则缩胎易产。 若倒横难生，或子死腹中，加黑豆一合，先炒熟，水、童便合煎。 若肠风藏毒，加槐花末半钱，三日取下血块即愈。 若吐血，加生地黄、黄苓、枳壳。 若血气，上喘下胀肿，加艾煎汤，空心调散服。 若产后血闷心迷，喘急腹痛，加炒黑豆一合，入姜汁同煎服。 若崩中漏下，失血不止，加香附子炒，每两入甘草一钱，汤点服。 若白带，加芍药半两，乾姜二钱半，同为末，米饮调下。 若赤白带下，加香附子、棕榈烧灰，同为末，米饮调下。 苦练丸，治赤白带。 苦练碎，酒炒　茴香炒　当归各五钱 右为细末，酒糊为丸，每服五十丸，空心，温酒送下。 又方，云母为粉，温水和服三方寸匕，立见神效。 又方，夏枯草花开时采，捣为末，每服二钱，食前温饮调下，能饮者酒服。 又方，用酸浆草阴乾为末，空心，酒下三钱匕。 治月候湛浊，赤白带下，多年不差者。 石燕一枚，於坚硬瓷器内，以温水磨服之。 丁香胶艾汤，治白带白崩之物，虽多间有，如屋漏水下，时有鲜血。 当归身一钱半　熟地黄　白芍药　川芎各半钱　阿胶六分，炒珠　丁香四分　生艾叶一钱 右当归酒洗，锉艾，亦锉川芎、丁香、地黄为细末，都作一服，水五盏，先煎作一盏半，去滓入阿胶，再煎至一盏，带热空心服之，三两服愈。 补经固真丸，治心胞尺脉极微，白带流而不止。 甘草炙　柴胡各一钱　黄苓一钱，令锉　乾姜末三钱　橘皮半钱　人参二钱　白葵花十六个，去萼剪　郁李仁一钱，去皮尖，另研如泥

**Four Substances Decoction**
*Shudihuang* (prepared rehmannia), *chuanxiong* (Sichuan lovage), *shaoyao* (peony), and *danggui* (tangkuei) – equal parts. Grind coarsely, decoct in water, and take.

**For women’s consumptive steaming fever**, add *digupi* (wolfberry root bark), *mudanpi* (moutan bark), *zhimu* (anemarrhena), *chaihu* (bupleurum), and *huangqin* (scutellaria).
**For restless fetus during pregnancy with incessant uterine bleeding**, add ten leaves of *ai* (mugwort), *ejiao* (ass-hide glue), *huangqi* (astragalus), and *cong* (scallion).
**For deficiency-cold of the blood organ with excessive uterine bleeding**, also add *ejiao* and *ai*.
**For blood collapse**, add *shengdihuang* (raw rehmannia), *puhuang* (cattail pollen), and *huangqin*; alternatively, add *adai* (large-leaf mugwort), *ai*, and *huangqin*.
**For blood deficiency with abdominal pain, slight sweating, and aversion to wind**, add *ezhu* (zedoary) and *guangui* (cassia bark).
**For wind-deficiency dizziness**, add *qinjiao* (large-leaf gentian) and *qianghuo* (notopterygium).
**For qi deficiency and weakness, with inability to rise and sudden collapse**, add *houpo* (magnolia bark) and *chenpi* (tangerine peel).
**For fever with restlessness and insomnia**, add *huanglian* (coptis) and *zhizi* (gardenia).
**For deficiency-cold with faint pulse, spontaneous sweating, and labored breathing**, add *ganjiang* (dried ginger) and *fuzi* (prepared aconite).
**For dampness obstruction with heavy limbs, cold body, and slight sweating**, add *baizhu* (atractylodes) and *fuling* (poria).
**For pain in the sinews, bones, and joints, or headache with chills**, add *qianghuo*, *fangfeng* (saposhnikovia), *gaoben* (Chinese lovage), and *xixin* (asarum).
**For deficiency-cold below the navel, abdominal pain, and dull pain in the lumbar spine**, add *xuanhusuo* (corydalis) and *kulian* (margosa bark), both stir-fried.
**For excessive menstruation without other symptoms**, add *huangqin* and *baizhu*.
**For scanty menstruation**, add *kuihua* (mallow flower) and *honghua* (safflower).
**For consumptive weakness with cough, panting, and fullness**, add *jiangzhi houpo* (ginger-processed magnolia bark) and *fuchao zhishi* (bran-fried immature bitter orange).
**For sudden uterine bleeding**, add *huangqin*.
**For blood stasis with abdominal pain**, add *ezhu*, *sanleng* (sparganium), *gui* (cassia), and *ganqi* (dried lacquer), stir-fried.
**For red and white vaginal discharge**, add *xiangfuzi* (nutgrass) and *gui* (cassia), stir-fried.
**For bloody dysentery**, add *ejiao*, *ai*, and *huanglian*.
**For postpartum bloody dysentery with abdominal pain**, add *huaihua* (sophora flower), *huanglian*, and *yumike* (opium poppy husk).
**For blood-heat contending with dry tongue and thirst**, add *gualou* (trichosanthes) and *maimendong* (ophiopogon).
**For intense thirst with desire to drink**, add *shigao* (gypsum) and *zhimu*.
**For constipation of the viscera and bowels**, add *dahuang* (rhubarb) and *taoren* (peach kernel).
**For vomiting**, add *baizhu*, *renshen* (ginseng), *huoxiang* (agastache), and *shengjiang* (fresh ginger).
**For deficiency-cold with chronic diarrhea**, add *guangui* and *fuzi* (prepared aconite).
**For deficiency-restlessness and insomnia**, add *zhuye* (bamboo leaf), *renshen*, and *suanzaoren* (spiny jujube seed).
**For sudden red eyes with cloudy nebula and unbearable pain**, add *fangfeng*, *qianghuo*, *fangji* (stephania, wine-soaked), and *caolongdan* (gentian, wine-soaked).

---

**Xiong Gui Decoction**
*Chuanxiong* and *danggui* – equal parts. [Method missing], decoct in water and take warm.

**For postpartum dizziness**, add *shaoyao* and *ganjuhua* (chrysanthemum).
**For postpartum abdominal pain**, add *guangui*, decoct with wine and boy’s urine.
**For fetal death or restless fetus during pregnancy**, add *zisu* (perilla), decoct with wine and water; if dead, it will descend; if alive, it will stabilize.
**For taking near term**, it hastens delivery.
**For transverse or difficult birth, or fetal death in utero**, add one *he* of *heidou* (black soybean), first stir-fried, then decoct with water and boy’s urine.
**For intestinal wind and visceral toxins**, add half a *qian* of *huaihua* powder; after three days, blood clots will descend, and recovery follows.
**For vomiting blood**, add *shengdihuang*, *huangqin*, and *zhiqiao* (immature bitter orange).
**For qi and blood causing upper panting and lower swelling**, decoct *ai* in water, take the decoction on an empty stomach with the powder.
**For postpartum blood stasis with mental confusion, panting, and abdominal pain**, add one *he* of stir-fried *heidou* and ginger juice, decoct together and take.

*Shigao*; *shuniangzi* (burdock fruit), stir-fried; *chuanxiong* – equal parts; *juhua*; *xixin* – half the amount.

**Gualou Powder**, for scant breast milk.
*Gualougen* (trichosanthes root); *bohe* (mint), dried – equal parts.

*Jingmi* (non-glutinous rice); *nuomi* (glutinous rice) – each half a *ge*; *shenggancao* (raw licorice) – half a *liang*; *wojuzi* (lettuce seeds) – one *ge*, washed thoroughly.

**Ruxiang Powder**, for *chuinǎi* (inflamed breast due to blocked milk ducts).
*Ruxiang* (frankincense) – one *qian*; *gualougen* powder – one *liang*.

**Jupi Powder**, for early-stage breast abscess, highly effective.
*Jupi* (tangerine peel), soaked in water, white pith removed, dried, and stir-fried with wheat bran until slightly yellow.
Grind into powder. For each dose, take two *qian*, mixed with wine and a small amount of ground *shexiang* (musk).

**Gualou Powder**, for breast abscess and *nǎiláo* (chronic breast inflammation), repeatedly proven effective.

Simmer in three *sheng* of *wuhuijiu* (low-ash wine) in a silver or stone vessel over low heat until reduced to one *sheng* of clear liquid. Divide into three doses.

**Lianqiao Powder**, for *dùrǔ* (jealous breast, a type of breast inflammation).
*Lianqiao* (forsythia); *shengma* (cimicifuga); *mangxiao* (mirabilite) – each one *liang*; *xuanshen* (scrophularia); *shaoyao* (peony); *bailian* (ampelopsis); *fangji* (stephania); *shegan* (belamcanda) – each eight *qian*; *dahuang* (rhubarb) – two *qian*; *gancao* (licorice) – six *qian*; *xingren* (apricot kernels), skin and tips removed – forty kernels.
Chop coarsely. Boil in five *sheng* of water until reduced to two *sheng*. Add *dahuang* and boil briefly, then add *mangxiao*. Divide into three doses.

**Formula for Yin-Erosion Sores**
*Danggui* (Chinese angelica); *shaoyao* (peony); *gancao* (licorice); *diyu* (sanguisorba); *xiongqiong* (ligusticum) – each three *liang*.
Chop finely. Boil in five *sheng* of water until reduced to two *sheng*. Strain and use as a fumigant and wash, three times daily and once at night.

**Alternative Formula**
*Puhuang* (cattail pollen) – one *sheng*; *shuiyin* (mercury) – one *liang*.
Grind evenly and dust onto the affected area.

**Alternative Formula**
*Xiamao* (shrimp shells); *tushi* (hare droppings) – equal parts.
Grind into powder and apply to the sores. Highly effective.

**For women who dream of copulating with ghosts, experiencing delusions, hearing phantom voices, and speaking incoherently.**
*Fushen* (poria with hostwood) – one and a half *liang*; *fuling* (poria); *renshen* (ginseng); *shichangpu* (acorus) – each one *liang*; *chixiaodou* (adzuki beans) – half a *liang*.
Chop coarsely. For each dose, take four *qian*, decocted in one *zhong* of water. Take warm before meals.

**Bixie Pellet**, for women afflicted by ghostly intercourse.
*Hutougu* (tiger bone) – two *liang*; *zhusha* (cinnabar); *xionghuang* (realgar); *cihuang* (orpiment); *guijiu* (podophyllum); *zaojia* ( gleditsia); *guijian* (holly); *lilu* (veratrum); *wuyiren* (ulmus fruit) – each one *liang*.
Grind the raw ingredients into powder and form into pills the size of a bullet using refined honey. Place one pill in a sachet and tie it to the left arm for men or the right arm for women. Additionally, burn one pill at the entrance of the patient’s home to repel all malevolent spirits.

**Changpu Powder**, for menstrual blockage, swelling, and pain in the vaginal area.
*Changpu* (acorus); *danggui* (Chinese angelica), stir-fried – each one *liang*; *qinjiao* (gentian) – seven and a half *qian*; *wuzhuyu* (evodia), prepared – half a *liang*.
Grind into coarse powder. For each dose, take three *qian*, decocted in one *zhong* of water with a five-*cun* section of *congbai* (scallion). Take warm on an empty stomach.

**Alternative Formula**
*Aiye* (mugwort) – five *liang*; *fangfeng* (saposhnikovia) – three *liang*; *daji* (euphorbia) – two *liang*.
Chop finely. Boil in one *dou* of water until reduced to five *sheng*. Use hot as a wash, three times daily. Avoid drafts and cold.

**For vaginal swelling or ulceration.**
*Mahuang* (ephedra); *huanglian* (coptis); *shechuang* (cnidium) – each two *liang*; *aiye* (mugwort) – one and a half *liang*; *wumei* (mume) – ten pieces.
Chop finely. Boil in one *dou* of water until reduced to five *sheng*. Strain and use hot as a wash. Avoid drafts and cold.

**Dahuang Powder**, for vaginal itching.
*Dahuang* (rhubarb), lightly stir-fried; *huangqin* (scutellaria); *huangqi* (astragalus), honey-fried – each one *liang*; *chishaoyao* (red peony); *xuanshen* (scrophularia); *danshen* (salvia); *shanzhuyu* (cornus); *shechuangzi* (cnidium fruit) – each half a *liang*.
Grind into fine powder. Take two *qian* mixed with warm wine before meals.

**Alternative Formula**
Burn *xingren* (apricot kernels) to ash, wrap in silk while hot, and insert into the vagina. Replace twice daily.

**Alternative Formula**
Wash with garlic decoction.

**Alternative Formula**
Wash with a decoction of *gouqigen* (lycium root).

**Alternative Formula**
Insert a hot chicken liver into the vagina. If worms are present, they will be expelled.

**Formula for vaginal itching with prolapse.**
Grind *fanshi* (alum) into powder. Take one *fangcunbi* with wine on an empty stomach, three times daily.

**Formula for vaginal prolapse.**
*Danggui* (Chinese angelica), stir-fried; *huangqin* (scutellaria) – each two *liang*; *muli* (oyster shell) – two and a half *liang*; *weipi* (hedgehog skin), roasted – one *liang*; *chishaoyao* (red peony) – one and a half *liang*.
Grind into fine powder. Take two *qian* mixed with warm wine before meals; rice broth may also be used.

**Formula for vaginal sores.**
*Xingren* (apricot kernels), stir-fried until charred; *xionghuang* (realgar); *fanshi* (alum) – each half a *liang*; *shexiang* (musk) – one *qian* two *fen*.
Grind into powder and apply inside the vagina.

**Neibu Pill**, for women suffering from the five taxations and seven injuries, infertility, and all ailments. Pregnancy is expected after one month of use, and all diseases will be cured.
*Bixie* (dioscorea) – four *liang*; *niuxi* (achyranthes); *wujiapi* (acanthopanax); *baizhu* (atractylodes) – each two *liang*; *chuanwu* (aconite), stir-fried; *zhishi* (citrus aurantium), bran-fried; *danshen* (salvia) – each one *liang*.
Grind into fine powder and form into pills the size of *tongzi* (paulownia seeds) using refined honey. Take twenty pills with warm wine on an empty stomach, at midday, and in the late afternoon. Discontinue upon conception.

**Diagnostic Verse**
Purple indicates cold damage,
Blue signals fright,
White denotes malnutrition,
Black arises from malign attack,
Yellow bespeaks spleen affliction.

chunks.original_text: 观儿颜色及男左女右手二指节文，如经过三节上者，难治。 自下而上看。 全婴紫圆，治小儿变蒸，发热不解，并挟伤寒，温壮后热不歇，腹中有痰癖，哺乳不进，乳则吐哯食痫，先寒后热，此方无所不治，虽下不虚人。 代赭石　赤石脂各一两　大杏仁五十粒，去皮尖　巴豆三＋粒，去壳，用厚纸槌#5 去油 或加青蒙石一钱重，另为末入和 右二味为末，别研巴、杏为膏，相和更捣一二千杵，当自相得，若硬，入炼熟蜜少许，同杵，收密器中。 若生才三十日儿，服止如麻子大一粒，与少乳汁令下，食顷又与，坐乳勿令多，至日中当小下则热除。 若未全除，明日更与一粒。 如百日儿，圆如小豆一粒，以此准定加减。 盖小儿初生，骨骼未成，筋骨未就，脏腑未充，精神未全，气血虚浮，肌肤软脆，资乳以养，积渐增长，故有变蒸之候。 三十二日为一变，变者变其形容，再变为一蒸，蒸者蒸长肌肉。 十变而五小蒸，又四大蒸，积五百七十六日，大小蒸俱毕，乃得成人。 故当变蒸之时，轻者体热而微惊，耳冷尻冷，上唇头有白泡起，如鱼目珠子，微汗时出。 其重者，体壮热而脉乱，或汗或不汗，不欲乳食，食辄吐哯，目白微赤，黑睛微白，变蒸毕则目明矣。 此乃气血周流，肌肤充溢所致，谨无他治，但少与紫圆微下，其热即退。 若二次下后，身有热而耳热、尻热，乃为他病，宜别治焉。 保婴桃红散，亦可用水煮面糊为丸，如龙眼大，临用各依汤使磨化服。 如用吞服，则丸如绿豆大，每服十五丸。 川乌　白附子各五钱，生用　大南星陈半夏各二钱，生用 右锉碎，以新汲井花水拌湿，瓦器中浸之，春五、夏三、秋七、冬十，日晒夜露，一日一换新水，日足晒乾为末，以好大粒朱砂五钱重，另研为细末，和如桃红色为度治急惊风薄荷、灯心、金银环同煎汤下，重则灸百会； 慢惊用全竭、钩藤同煎汤下，重灸百会； 呕泻，姜葱煎汤下，或老米饮加酸醋一呷下； 腹痛，淡姜汤下； 咳嗽，桑白皮煎汤下； 胎惊夜啼及觉腹中有虫，用苦练根皮煎汤，露一宿下； 伤风咳嗽，姜葱煎汤下； 疟亦姜葱汤下，后用姜汤调末子服，尤佳。 保命丹，治小儿急慢惊风，痰涎壅盛，牙关紧急，角弓反张，睡中惊跳，哭泣叫啖，偏搐斜目，面青脸赤，两眼直视，手足搐搦，天吊客件，摇头上窜，一切风痰并皆治之。 大个无油南星二两，煨　朋砂净，六钱　白僵蚕二两，姜汁浸炒　茯神去皮尖，六钱　蝉退去头足翅净，一两　白矾一两，火枯　天龙四条，酒煮，即娱蚣也　麝香一钱　全蝎去尾毒净，用二两，糯米炒黄为度，去米　远志去骨用净肉，一两，甘草一节同煮过，去草　大粒朱砂五钱，另研为衣　猪牙皂角二两，打碎，煎浓汁 右先将南星煨，以皂角汁淬十数次，余皂汁留煮米糊，以前药俱为末，丸如龙眼大，以朱砂为衣，阴乾，每用一丸，以薄荷、灯草、金银环子同煎，汤浸磨化，临时於火上顿温与服。 保童丹，治小儿急慢惊风，痰涎咳嗽，喘满，不进乳食，虫疳，积热膨胀等证。 陈枳壳五对，大者去根，用巴豆七粒，去壳入内，以线十字缚定，好醋反覆煮软，去巴切片，焙乾，余醋留煮糊　三棱　莪术煨，各五钱　金箔十个　朱砂二钱，另研

Examine the child’s complexion and the creases on the second joint of the index finger—left for boys, right for girls. If the creases extend beyond three joints, the condition is difficult to treat. Observe from the lower joint upward.

**Quanzhen Purple Pill** treats infantile *bianzheng* (febrile growth phases), persistent fever, concurrent cold damage, lingering heat after *wenzhuang* (warmth taxation), abdominal phlegm accumulations, refusal to nurse, vomiting upon feeding, food epilepsy, alternating chills and fever. This formula treats all such conditions, and though it induces purgation, it does not debilitate.

*Daizheshi* (hematite) and *chishizhi* (halloysite) – each one *liang*; fifty *daxingren* (apricot kernels), peeled and tips removed; thirty *badou* (croton seeds), shelled, pounded in thick paper to remove oil. Optionally add *qingmengshi* (chlorite schist), one *qian* in weight, ground separately and blended in.

Grind the first two ingredients into powder, then separately grind the *badou* and *xingren* into a paste. Combine and pound together one to two thousand times until thoroughly blended. If too stiff, add a small amount of refined honey and pound again. Store in a sealed vessel.

For a thirty-day-old infant, administer a pill the size of a sesame seed with a small amount of breast milk. After a short while, give another dose, but do not allow excessive nursing. By midday, mild purgation should occur, and the fever will resolve. If not fully resolved, administer another pill the following day. For a hundred-day-old infant, use a pill the size of a small soybean, adjusting the dose accordingly.

Infants are born with underdeveloped bones, sinews, organs, and spirit, their *qi* and blood deficient and superficial, their skin tender. Nourished by milk, they gradually grow, undergoing *bianzheng* (transformative phases). Every thirty-two days marks one *bian* (transformation), altering their appearance, followed by one *zheng* (steaming), which fosters muscle growth. After ten *bian* and five minor *zheng*, plus four major *zheng*, totaling 576 days, all phases conclude, and the child matures.

During *bianzheng*, mild cases present with body heat, slight fright, cold ears and coccyx, white blisters on the upper lip resembling fish eyes, and intermittent sweating. Severe cases exhibit high fever, disordered pulse, sweating or its absence, refusal to nurse, vomiting upon feeding, pale whites of the eyes with slight redness, and a faintly white iris—though vision clears after *bianzheng* concludes. These symptoms arise from the circulation of *qi* and blood and the filling of the flesh. No other treatment is needed; administer a small dose of the Purple Pill to induce mild purgation, and the fever will recede. If, after two purgations, the body remains warm with hot ears and coccyx, the condition is unrelated to *bianzheng* and requires separate treatment.

**Baoying Peach-Red Powder** may also be prepared as pills using water-cooked flour paste, the size of longan fruit. For use, dissolve in the appropriate decoction. If swallowed whole, form pills the size of mung beans and administer fifteen per dose.

*Chuanwu* (aconite) and *baifuzi* (typhonium), raw – each five *qian*; *dananxing* (bile-processed arisaema) and *chenbanxia* (aged pinellia), raw – each two *qian*.

Crush the ingredients, moisten with freshly drawn well water, and soak in an earthenware vessel. In spring, soak for five days; in summer, three; in autumn, seven; in winter, ten. Expose to sunlight by day and dew by night, changing the water daily. Once the soaking period is complete, dry in the sun and grind into powder. Add five *qian* of high-quality, coarse *zhusha* (cinnabar), separately ground to a fine powder, and blend until the mixture turns peach-red.

For **acute fright wind**, administer with a decoction of mint, rush pith, and gold or silver rings; in severe cases, moxa *baihui*. For **chronic fright wind**, use with a decoction of scorpion and *gouteng* (uncaria); in severe cases, moxa *baihui*. For **vomiting and diarrhea**, use with a decoction of ginger and scallion, or old rice water with a sip of vinegar. For **abdominal pain**, use with a mild ginger decoction. For **cough**, use with a decoction of *sangbaipi* (mulberry root bark). For **fetal fright, night crying, or suspected intestinal parasites**, use with a decoction of *kulian* (melia) root bark, exposed to dew overnight. For **wind-cold cough**, use with a decoction of ginger and scallion. For **malaria**, use with a decoction of ginger and scallion, then administer the powder mixed with ginger decoction for enhanced effect.

**Baoming Pill** treats infantile acute and chronic fright wind, profuse phlegm and drool, clenched jaw, opisthotonos, nighttime fright and crying, squinting eyes, cyanotic or flushed face, fixed gaze, convulsions, *tian diao* (heavenly suspension) and *ke jian* (guest fright), head shaking, upward staring, and all wind-phlegm disorders.

Two *liang* of large, oil-free *nanxing* (arisaema), roasted; six *qian* of refined *pengsha* (borax); two *liang* of *baijiangcan* (silkworm), soaked in ginger juice and stir-fried; six *qian* of *fushen* (poria with hostwood), peeled; one *liang* of *chantui* (cicada molting), cleaned of head, feet, and wings; one *liang* of *baifan* (alum), calcined; four *tianlong* (centipedes), wine-boiled; one *qian* of *shexiang* (musk); two *liang* of *quanxie* (scorpions), tails removed, stir-fried with glutinous rice until yellow, then rice discarded; one *liang* of *yuan zhi* (polygala), bones removed, meat only, boiled with a piece of licorice and then licorice discarded; five *qian* of coarse *zhusha* (cinnabar), separately ground for coating; two *liang* of *zhuya zao* (pig’s tooth hawthorn), crushed and decocted into a thick liquid.

First roast the *nanxing*, then quench it ten times in the *zao* decoction. Reserve the remaining decoction to cook rice paste. Grind all ingredients into powder, form into pills the size of longan fruit, and coat with *zhusha*. Dry in the shade. For use, dissolve one pill in a decoction of mint, rush pith, and gold or silver rings, warming it over a fire before administration.

**Baotong Pill** treats infantile acute and chronic fright wind, phlegm cough, wheezing, refusal to nurse, parasitic malnutrition, accumulated heat, and abdominal distension.

Five pairs of large *chen zhiqiao* (aged citrus aurantium), roots removed, with seven *badou* (croton seeds) inserted into each, tied with thread, and boiled in good vinegar until soft. Remove the *badou*, slice the *zhiqiao*, and dry by baking. Reserve the remaining vinegar for cooking paste. Five *qian* each of *sanleng* (sparganium) and *ezhu* (curcuma), roasted; ten *jinbo* (gold leaf); two *qian* of *zhusha* (cinnabar), separately ground.

chunks.original_text: 右为末，以前醋煮面糊为丸，绿豆大，朱砂为衣。 未及周岁一丸，周岁已上三丸，三岁已下五丸，已上七丸，用薄荷、灯心、金银环同煎汤下，不能吞，磨化与服。 急救仙方卷之三竟 #1肢：原作 『技』，据文义改。 #2搏：原作『慱』，据文义改。 #3生：疑当作『性』。 #4搏：原作『博』，据文义改。 #5槌：原作 『追』，据文义改。 急救仙方卷之四 济阴品 序论医经云：香附子，妇人仙药，常用导血调气，佐以乌药，使阳不至强，阴不至弱。 自女子而至妇人，由有生以来，虽日禀赋，众阴所集，以血为主，得病之因，其源皆未有不先因气所触作，然后血气相搏#1，结成大病。 盖以血本属阴，性柔软闰，易於成病，感热即血溢，冒寒即血凝； 劳伤之过，血失常经，喜怒不常，血结气聚； 忧思不伸，血不归络。 又巢氏云：血得凉而生，医治之问，轻重失审，冷热有差，未免转成他疾，而有伤生之危，可不慎哉。 今此前后用方，性味温平，乃出神仙之旨要，不凉不僭，顺荣卫之疏通，胎前产后无不备矣。 若老若少，皆获全生。 切恐用方之士疑此药品之不精良，妄意浅近而轻忽之，却不知此方为女人养生去疾之宝，可不依而行之，诸方逐一故具于后。 异香四神散又名四神汤，专调理妇人室女血气不调，及胎前产后诸疾皆主之。 盖女人以气血为主，殊不知因气先不调，然后血脉不顺，即生诸证，此方大有奥理。 香附子去毛炒，半斤　乌药炒，四两　甘草炙，一两 右□咀，每服五钱重，水一盏，生姜三片，枣一个，煎至七分，去滓，空心温服。 或用葱白三寸同煎。 如治诸证，依后加减用之，立见功效。 妇人气血不顺，心胸痞满，加紫苏叶同煎。 惊忧闷气，喜怒伤神，心满腹疼，面目虚浮，及一切气疾，并加石菖蒲同煎。 血脉不调，血膈番胃，呕吐饮食，以老姜一块，烧令黑，切作五片，入盐少许同煎。 脾胃感冷，亦依前用。 血积、血晕闷、血症、血刺痛，煎熟入好醋一呷服。 经血行时被风雨，或惊忧相并，经候不时，名曰搐脉，腹痛紧胀，腰腿疼痛，每服加炒茴香一撮同煎。 血气不顺，喘满气急，面目浮肿，加生姜、紫苏叶同煎。 唾血，咯红痰，喉中腥气，加黄桑叶三四皮，花桑尤佳。 血涩气秘，大便结滞不通，宜加枳壳数片，或去白青皮亦可。 凡血脏虚冷，血涩腹痛，血海久冷，血崩，赤白带下，小便频数，又血脉妄行，渗入大肠，有似肠风并入，炒吴茱萸末一匕同煎，易名温经汤。 经络感热经水沸溢，血脉妄行，病曰热崩，加生地黄。 凡败血攻冲脾胃，血噎气血，若咳逆，加生姜三片、柿蒂五个。 血气昏闷，心腹刺痛，加良姜、赤芍药，以水酒各半盏同煎。 胎脉伤食，胸膈闷不快，噎气食臭，心腹紧满，更加南木香，或宿砂仁煎。 怀胎临月，近上逼心，名日子悬，依旧用姜片、紫苏同煎。 产后诸疾，不明血脉去留，不辨虚实冷热，且宜此药通顺血气，不致差误，然后随证调理。 产后寒气入腹硬紧，脐下刺痛，名日寒疝，加炒昊茱萸煎。 产后，因产中用力太过，子宫脱下，俗名□病，先用此顺气安肠，兼以樗树根或枝梗，同葱白，以花椒煎汤熏洗，子肠自定，及平居女人患此，亦然。
